item.title: With co-founders leaving and an IPO looming, Elon Musk turns talk to the moon
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: According to The New York Times, which reports that it heard the meeting, Musk told employees that xAI needs a lunar manufacturing facility, a factory on the moon that will build AI satellites and fling them into space via a giant catapult.

item.title: OpenAI policy exec who opposed chatbot’s “adult mode” reportedly fired on discrimination claim
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The executive has denied the allegation that she engaged in discrimination.

item.title: Okay, now exactly half of xAI’s founding team has left the company
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: Whatever the cause of the departures, the cumulative impact is alarming. There is a lot of work left to do at xAI, and an IPO will bring more scrutiny than the lab has ever faced before.

item.title: Amazon may launch a marketplace where media sites can sell their content to AI companies
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: A new report claims the e-commerce giant is looking to create a pipeline of licensable content between media publishers and AI companies.

item.title: An ice dance duo skated to AI music at the Olympics
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Czech ice dancers Katerina Mrazkova and Daniel Mrazek are learning the hard way that LLMs sometimes spit out straight-up plagiarism.

item.title: This Sequoia-backed lab thinks the brain is ‘the floor, not the ceiling’ for AI
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom, Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: AI lab Flapping Airplanes just landed $180 million in seed funding from the likes of Google Ventures, Sequoia, and Index to do something most labs have quietly given up on: making models learn like humans instead of vacuuming up the internet. The founding team, made up of brothers Ben and Asher Spector and co-founder Aidan Smith, is […]

item.title: Boston Dynamics CEO Robert Playter steps down after 30 years at the company
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Robert Playter announcd he is leaving Boston Dynamics after 30 years at the company in various roles, including six years as CEO.

item.title: Facebook adds new AI features, animated profile photos, and backgrounds for text posts
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Facebook's new AI features let users animate their profile pics, restyle their Stories and Memories, and add backgrounds to text posts.

item.title: Vega raises $120M Series B to rethink how enterprises detect cyber threats
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Vega Security raised $120 million, bringing its valuation to $700 million, in a round led by Accel. The company aims to rethink how enterprises detect cybersecurity threats.

item.title: Hauler Hero collects $16M for its AI waste management software
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Hauler Hero has seen its customer base, revenue, and head count double since the company raised its seed round in 2024.

item.title: India orders social media platforms to take down deepfakes faster
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: India’s new rules take effect February 20, tightening deepfake oversight and shrinking takedown windows to as little as two hours.

item.title: Former GitHub CEO raises record $60M dev tool seed round at $300M valuation
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Thomas Dohmke's new startup offers an AI system to allow developers to better manage all the code AI agents produce.

item.title: AI video startup Runway raises $315M at $5.3B valuation, eyes more capable world models
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Startup Runway has raised a $315 million round at a $5.3 billion valuation, funds it will use to expand beyond AI video generation and into world models.

item.title: The first signs of burnout are coming from the people who embrace AI the most
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Because employees could do more, work began bleeding into lunch breaks and late evenings. The employees' to-do lists expanded to fill every hour that AI freed up, and then kept going.

item.title: Databricks CEO says SaaS isn’t dead, but AI will soon make it irrelevant
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: AI isn't going to replace major SaaS apps with vibe-coded versions, Databricks CEO Ali Ghodsi believes. But it could give rise to competitors.

item.title: Anthropic’s India expansion collides with a local company that already had the name
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: India's Anthropic Software has taken the U.S. AI giant to court over a name dispute.

item.title: ChatGPT rolls out ads
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: OpenAI faced a backlash late last year when it tested app suggestions that looked like unwanted ads. Still, the AI company needs to generate revenue from its popular chatbot to cover the costs of developing its technology and growing the business.

item.title: Workday CEO Eschenbach departs, with co-founder Aneel Bhusri returning as CEO
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Bhusri said in a statement that the company's next chapter would be focused on AI.

item.title: Anthropic closes in on $20B round
item.dc:creator: Tim Fernholz
item.description: The company raised $13 billion in equity funding just five months ago, but intense competition between frontier labs and the ongoing cost of compute have made them eager to raise as quickly as possible.

item.title: Ex-Googlers are building infrastructure to help companies understand their video data
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: Founded by former Google Japan leaders, InfiniMind is building enterprise AI to turn vast, unused video archives into searchable, actionable business intelligence.
